detectors.description:
Microsoft.transfer(address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#37-46) may have integer overflow
	Possible nodes:
	- balances[msg.sender] -= value (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#39)
	- balances[to] += value (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#40)
detectors.markdown:
[Microsoft.transfer(address,uint256)](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#L37-L46) may have integer overflow
	Possible nodes:
	- [balances[msg.sender] -= value](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#L39)
	- [balances[to] += value](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#L40)

detectors.description:
Microsoft.transferFrom(address,address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#48-63) may have integer overflow
	Possible nodes:
	- (balances[to] * 10) <= balances[from] (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#49)
	- balances[to] += value (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#53)
	- balances[from] -= value (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#54)
	- allowed[from][msg.sender] -= value (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#55)
detectors.markdown:
[Microsoft.transferFrom(address,address,uint256)](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#L48-L63) may have integer overflow
	Possible nodes:
	- [(balances[to] * 10) <= balances[from]](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#L49)
	- [balances[to] += value](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#L53)
	- [balances[from] -= value](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#L54)
	- [allowed[from][msg.sender] -= value](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#L55)

detectors.description:
Microsoft.smartfastConstructorVariables() (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#14-86) uses literals with too many digits:
	- initialSupply = 20000000 * 10 ** uint256(decimals) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#16)
detectors.markdown:
[Microsoft.smartfastConstructorVariables()](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#L14-L86) uses literals with too many digits:
	- [initialSupply = 20000000 * 10 ** uint256(decimals)](tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#L16)

detectors.description:
totalSupply() should be declared external:
	- ERC20.totalSupply() (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#4)
	- Microsoft.totalSupply() (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#23-25)

balanceOf(address) should be declared external:
	- Microsoft.balanceOf(address) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#29-31)
	- ERC20.balanceOf(address) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#5)

allowance(address,address) should be declared external:
	- Microsoft.allowance(address,address) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#33-35)
	- ERC20.allowance(address,address) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#6)

approve(address,uint256) should be declared external:
	- Microsoft.approve(address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#69-73)
	- ERC20.approve(address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#8)

transfer(address,uint256) should be declared external:
	- Microsoft.transfer(address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#37-46)
	- ERC20.transfer(address,uint256) (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol#9)
function approve(address spender, uint256 value) public returns (bool success) { (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol)#69
function transfer(address to, uint256 value) public returns (bool success) { (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol)#37
function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 value) public returns(bool success) { (tests_etherscan/dataset_etherscan/Microsoft.sol)#48
